column4: hm ... so i should specify the jumpers differently than CS ?  ok well there's 1 SATA drive (that's the new one) and there is 1 IDE (the old drive). what should i set the jumper to on the IDE drive? Master? Slave? i would guess Master since that's what it did by itself ?
the disks have labels on them on how to set the jumpersa
should prolly set the jumpers and use the right cable ends
- the cable IS set, to CS.  and the cable ends are in properly. if it weren't, fdisk wouldn't see the disk, would it?    and fdisk does see the disk.
lol, and what's the problem?
the problem is that the mount command is not recognizing the partition i want to mount.
and fdisk sees them?
yes
whats the error?

it is this errror:   mount: wrong fs type, bad option, bad superblock on /dev/sda1, missing codepage or helper program, or other error  In some cases useful info is found in syslog - try  dmesg | tail  or so
what's fs type?
it's Linux
wow weird..
yes
you tried formatting the drive?
i need to grab data off the drive before i do that.
now thats a problem,
- gee thanks, you get two points for being master of the obvious :D  if it wasn't a problem, i wouldn't be trying to solve it.
sorry couldn't help..
thanks all the same it is all appreciated :)
well you can try a a linux recovery on windows
actually i'm doing all of this just so i can wipe the disk and put windows on the old hdd (just to test it for something). so i can't try a linux recovery on windows atm.
